entries.name: content
entries.desc: target is the “name” of the Instruction; IE, the “tag” in <?tag …?> content is everything else.

entries.name: target
entries.desc: target is the “name” of the Instruction; IE, the “tag” in <?tag …?> content is everything else.

entries.name: new(target, content=nil)
entries.desc: Constructs a new Instruction @param target can be one of a number of things.  If String, then the target of this instruction is set to this.  If an Instruction, then the Instruction is shallowly cloned (target and content are copied). @param content Must be either a String, or a Parent.  Can only be a Parent if the target argument is a Source.  Otherwise, this String is set as the content of this instruction.

entries.name: ==( other )
entries.desc: @return true if other is an Instruction, and the content and target of the other matches the target and content of this object.
